page.title: 01A CHILD'S LIFE IN HIGHNAM
page.content: When questioned about summer term activities,the pupils of Highnam Primary school highlighted sucesses at netball and for the choir at the Cheltenham Festival.School parties went to Wales,Holland,Belgium and Tibberton for the Domesday project.A gym club display and a sponsored netball match,which itself raised Â£800,were enjoyed by large audiences. The peace and tranquility of Highnam and a friendly community make it appealing to live in.However,former town dwellers said they missed the hustle and bustle of the city.In the holidays,Gloucester provides sporting facilities,as do the local playing fields and woods.Yet the school,being the place the children most frequently go to,remains at the centre of their village life.
